Description: Necklace: composed of many small disc beads of uniform diameter and a few larger, all of cornelian, together with three long convex bicones and two short barrel beads of electrum.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Mostagedda, Grave 544 Found at the neck of a female.
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: bangle (1929,1015.468), bracelet with amulet (1929,1015.469), girdles (1929,1015.470 & 1929,1015.471 & 1929,1015.472 & 1929,1015.473), necklace (1929,1015.474). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 101-2; pl.LXVII, tomb group (beads not drawn); Tomb register, pl.XLVlll; Bead register, pl.XLIXA.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (343)
